title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open a file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: Open a java file in the Java Perspective by double-clicking on it in the workbench. Right-click on the same java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. Nothing happens and no warning or error message is displayed.
EB: A warning message should be displayed in the workbench, informing the user that opening the file in another editor may overwrite changes. The message should give the option to continue or an error message should be displayed instructing the user to close all files first.
SR:
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on a java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
3. Verify that a warning message is displayed in the workbench, allowing you to choose whether to continue or an error message is displayed instructing you to close all files first.
